author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Care has been pretty brilliant so far
body: The care that I have been seeing in the hospital has so far been pretty good and I really don't think that I have found anything to complain about so far as the care is just brilliant and I am very happy with it. The staff are all so kind really couldn't ask for better there all nice enough to explain the treatment to me and anything that needs explained again I can asked for answers. I really haven’t had an issue so far I am very happy with it all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Explained in a way that I understand
body: 4 North has been pretty okay so far really haven't found a thing to complain about so far as I have been treated pretty good. The staff that the ward has are honestly pretty especially like I know myself I really couldn't ask for a better bunch of people looking after me they have been so good and are all very good at communicating with me in a way that I understand and always answer my questions. The foods really quite good too I like it

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Not a complaint
body: The care here has been pretty decent I really don't think that I have anything to complain about so far its been good. They treat me very well and have checked up on me several times today. I know there there if I need anything and always take the time to answer my questions and just reassure me a lot throughout the weeks ive been here. I have not an issue with the care and even think the food is good

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: julybg36
title: My time in the Day Surgery Unit
body: I spent several hours in the Day Surgery Unit at Forth Valley Royal Hospital and received excellent care, particularly from nurses Isabel and Susan. In recovery I was looked after by Heather and EJ who were also fantastic. Anaesthetists Daniel and Sharon were also extremely professional and I had a generally very good experience.

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Hospitals been okay so far
body: The care that I have gotten in the hospital has honestly been okay so far and I don’t really think that I have anything bad that I could say so far. The staff have been pretty excellent so far like I really appreciate the way they take time to answer my questions and explain things to me very well,. The food really isn’t half bad either I am just grateful to have no issues so far and juts feel I’m treated good

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sagittaxt46
title: Neurology Clinic Belfast City Hospital
body:
I had a review appointment in the Neurology clinic in Belfast City Hospital I seen Dr McMullan at the clinic I have been diagnosed with MS for over 10years and I can honestly say this was the best appointment I have had with a consultant since diagnosis.  
He spent time explaining everything to me and my husband and answered all our questions. I have to say his empathy and listening skills were exceptional throughout the appointment. I left this appointment with a clear understanding of what to expect and he also made a follow up call.  
This was a very positive patient experience and I have to commend this Dr McMullan on his care throughout the appointment

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cland93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are Brillant
body: I have been in hospital for the last 3 days, I am in a lovely little room of my own which is great when it comes to bed time I have been sleeping great.  Food is great if I was hungry enough to eat.  The staff on Female Medical are brillant, every one does there best.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jacob65
title: After 30 years, I feel broken by the mental health system
body:
I’ve come to a place now where I have no trust in the mental health services. I feel broken by a system that claims to care for people in distress.  
I appreciate that the services are now very overwhelmed but that doesn’t excuse the ongoing bigotry and attitudes towards patients with the diagnosis of BPD. I have been under the care of mental health services for over 30yrs with varying degrees of needs at different times. At times needing very little care, to in 2021 being sectioned.  
As I get older I feel my mental health has deteriorated to the point that last year I lost my job. The input I receive however is minimal. It involves a 30 minute appt every 3 to 4 months with a psychiatrist that doesn’t really listen.  
I am unable to drive a car now so request a telephone appt as I refuse to be seen in the town where I live, due to a very abusive doctor. Yet every time I ring to request a phone call I’m interrogated by the receptionist. I’m told I need to be seen face to face for full assessment purposes. I understand the rationale but surely a phone call is better than no contact at all?  
On the day however there was no phone call as the message hadn’t been given to the psychiatrist so I rang and he did ring me back. My call with him in November 2022 was frustrating to say the least. He doesn’t really listen to what you’re saying.  
At the end of the phone call he told me I was encroaching on another patients time, as I was holding my phone to my ear and unable to know how long we’d been talking or that he had another patient. How did it become my fault for taking someone else’s time?  
He then said he had seen ten patients that day and said “That’s a lot isn’t it?” Not sure why his patient list had suddenly become my responsibility, was he trying to make me feel bad for him? He did however say at the end of the call he would refer me to the personality disorder service and for some more therapy, and try and get me some help.  
I rang them today to find out the waiting times to be seen. I was told there was no referral. I’m told to reach out all the time: if you need help reach out. When I do reach out, most times I’m met with indifference, silence, judgement and blame.  
The last time I spoke to someone from the crisis team she said she wanted to “shake me!” And told me I needed to “Get a grip on this!” This kind of response is so unhelpful and unprofessional.  
Before I was sectioned I was trying to talk about being sexually assaulted to another crisis team nurse. She assumed I was talking about childhood experiences. Her response to me was “but you’re a grown man now!” How invalidating and dismissive is that response to someone’s trauma. How does that help someone by basically saying “get over it”. I didn’t even want to see the crisis team at that point, my former manager had insisted I was sectioned on the same day.  
I’ve had some good experiences with some staff but the bad overshadow these. I didn’t choose to have things happen to me and I definitely didn’t choose to have BPD. Why on earth would someone choose such a destructive, harmful, demonised condition which leaves you open to verbal abuse, sarcasm, derision and bullying by some mental health professionals?  
I’m so exhausted by it all now. I’m in my 50s now and feel very lost, scared and alone. I seem to have been blacklisted by my local mental health team as even after being sectioned, a referral was made from the ward to the CMHT and was immediately refused as now any intervention is just deemed to be of no benefit. I’m struggling with my mental health more than ever and the GP will say to contact my mental health team which consists of a psychiatrist I barely have any contact with.  
So I just say no thank you, I’d rather not talk and be dismissed, lectured or have sarcastic comments made. I don’t things will ever change. I think they will get worse but I’m one person with a stupid diagnosis, who’s going to listen to me?  
I will eventually become another statistic and will be forever forgotten in a broken system that no longer cares about human beings. I’m just another PD on a conveyer belt of irritating patients. I’m so very tired now.

author: MissusC
title: NHS 24 and Out of hours urgent care Fife
body: My son had a nasty earache. We had to call NHS24. Yes there was a decent wait, but Daria the call handler was excellent and was reassuring and friendly and checked in with me when her handover to the nurse took longer than expected. The nurse, Gillian, was prompt and efficient and arranged an appointment at our local Urgent Care. Although the appt was 2330 they apologised for the late timing and the staff there were also excellent and efficient. My son felt reassured and has been given appropriate treatment. Well done to all.

author: Bunchlet59
title: He gave him lots of good tips
body:
My husband suffers from Asthma he got a heavy cold on his chest. He rang Out of Hours and yes the procedure is laborious. However, he was given an appointment and saw a GP. The GP was a Dr McCaffery. He was professional and listened and carried out an examination. He gave him lots of good tips and a prescription.  
As a family we don't like to use OOH service because you hear such horror stories. We can only speak as we found they were there when we required medical assistance. The assistance was of the highest standard. My advice is if you have a need ring and seek assistance. They are there to support you.I believe it isn't the receptionist fault nor the nurse advisors fault. Everyone is trying to do the best they can. Doctors can not work any faster. At the end of the day they are human. Unfortunately there isn't enough of them.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Lovely Hospital
body:
Thank you for the care you gave to my relative.
The Princess of Wales Hospital is an excellent NHS Hospital run by dedicated staff.

title: Best surgery anywhere
body: One reads of problems with other GP practises - but not at Medwyns. Despite all the problems of recent years I have never been let down by anyone at the surgery from the receptionists to every doctor nurse and specialist.  Thank you

title: Thorough check up
body: Asthma review. Really thorough and didn’t feel rushed at all! Answered all of my questions and put my mind at ease!

title: Fantastic service
body: At about 9 am I went on line and submitted details of a problem I was experiencing. By 11 am I had received a phone call from a doctor who discussed my ailment in great depth and arranged for me to attend the surgery for treatment.  The speed that this was all dealt with so quickly and efficiently is first class.

author: Mae2023
title: My visit to the New Victoria was a hugely reassuring one.
body:
I was very worried about the unknown when I was sent for a consultation to the Gyneacology clinic. I was met by Nurses Lesley Ann and Audrey who immediately put me at my ease, reassured me and explained the details of my possible condition in easy to understand language. They talked about alternative treatments and then proceeded to an examination. One never enjoys the process of intimate examination but the nurses were gentle and efficient and I had the most minimum of discomfort, very unlike a recent examination.  
And here is the marked difference, the hospital visits I have had recently, including todays, were marked by courteous concern and reassuring treatment by both doctors and nurses. I have found when I try to communicate with my GP surgery an appointment is often unavailable, the doctor is not in or an appointment is rushed or I have to explain by remote diagnosis via an on line questionnaire, nor do I actually know who my doctor is. So my visit to the New Victoria was a hugely reassuring one. One that was also very emotional, where I felt a kindness and concern from a caring staff. Thank you Lesley Ann and Audrey. The NHS is our very heart without it untold misery and pain would ensue it would destroy so much hope and faith in our country. These nurses restored mine.

title: Beautiful people
body: For someone who has had little to do with doctors , hospitals etc , in general , ..... I am fully comforted. Prompt , polite and kind attention. Total thoroughness. Within a few hours I had been seen by a consultant who removed a ring on a badly swollen finger. Then an x-ray , then a hand specialist. Bloods followed and a final chat with a Registrar and follow up appointment booked. Absolutely amazing and every person I interacted with were so extremely kind , gentle and thorough. Brilliant , I take my hat off to you all !!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

author: Relrc69
title: Mother's experience
body:
Thank you for your hard work and dedication.  
Your attitudes and smiles was the highlight of my mother's stay in Ward 2.  
Thank you also for you excellent communication and generosity towards me.

author: ADiplexcito
title: Thank you so much to the staff of Ward 34
body: Thank you so much to the staff of Ward 34, Ninewells who went above and beyond to look after me during an unexpected stay over the weekend. All of the staff took time to chat and check up on me regularly and nothing was too much for them. As a breastfeeding mother, I felt very well supported. Staff quickly sourced a breast pump for me and were excellent at checking I had everything I needed and giving me privacy to express milk. Special thanks to Zoe (nightshift nurse) who gave me some fruit from her own lunchbox when the kitchen was shut and so there was no gluten free food available for me. Thanks also to Michelle and Zanaib who were always bright, chatty and cheery!

author: Mack23
title: Hospital at home service
body: I experienced fluid build up due to congestive heart failure. My body filled with fluid from feet to neck. Felt breathless, pain in legs, difficulty walking, fatigued.

title: Amazing care
body: We had to take our son to the Beverley and Hull Royal A & E departments yesterday and then was referred to the Urology department at Castle Hill late last night.  We can’t thank all the staff at each hospital enough, each and everyone of them from the reception staff to the nurses and doctors.  They were all so amazing, caring and friendly.  Thank you

readBy.name: Hull University Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Oral
title: Glasgow  Dental  Hospital
body: I have been going here for many years and have had excellent care and advice from all the Students regarding oral hygiene. I am also more than happy with all the treatment I have received.  I felt very welcome, at ease and everyone was friendly.

title: Good practice
body:
Oak Lodge medical Centre is a good place to go for medical treatment. 
Services at the reception was good.
Finally the Doctor I met was very patient, he listened to me and took care of me and prescribed my medication without wasting much time.

title: Outstanding service
body: My 96 Yr old mother was attended by x2 wonderful ambulance staff today. Their approach and communication skills were exemplary which instantly put my mum at ease whilst they conducted their assessment. It was really wonderful to witness such dedication and commitment

author: aquariusqy37
title: Very well looked after
body: My son was in the children's ward today for constant vomiting and high temperature, he's also a newly diagnosed type 1 diabetic. We were made to feel at ease and were very well looked after by Sharon and Paul.

title: Excellent Team.
body:
Excellent team very professional all very helpful. 
Op straight forward and painless marked difference in clarity  of sight looking forward to next eye being done.

title: Brilliant
body: I went with my 4 year old and both scared of needles the nurse talked us both through and was amazing my daughter was happy with 2 stickers and a certificate and no tears

title: Good community service
body:
Great practice, never let me down. Now 65 and they are still looking after me well.
Perhaps I’m lucky as not had to wait too long, nurses and doctors always polite and give helpful advise.

title: Great Practice with even better receptionists
body:
I changed to this practice recently. I’ve needed to contact them twice for an appointment and on each occasion I was offerred the same day by incredibly efficient , friendly and professional receptionists. Furthermore, today ( my second consultation I was in the waiting room for a while and saw one of the receptionists go out of her way to speak with a very upset gentleman. She was lovely. Went to the doctor with a special request for the patient who had quite a few challenges. He came into the surgery very unhappy and left happy after a really caring intervention and advice from the receptionist. Myself and other patients waiting, were smiling with pleasure at the way the situation was handled. 
My appointment with the GP was great. Informative. I had great care.
On my way out, I thanked the reception team and they were visibly moved by the positive feedback I gave them. They talked about how negative reviews and feedback ‘tore them up forecweeks’. They really cared and I thought how brilliant the people in our nhs are. What a great move to change to this Practice. Thank you!

title: Good Service
body: I called and got through, asked if I could see a lady GP, receptionist was lovely and I was seen by a very nice lady GP. I couldn’t fault the practice today for the way I was treated.

title: Brilliant Service
body: I have had both eyes done over the last 8weeks and I cannot fault anything about the whole process. Wonderful staff who made me feel at ease and every thing explained to me and was cared for from start to finish . Already my new vision is great . Well done to the Leeds Clinic.

title: Such an improvement
body:
I can’t tell you the difference there has been since the gp has been taken over. It runs so much better and I can’t fault the service.

Very happy

title: Improved Practice
body: I was invited for a health check which i had with the nurse. She was very friendly and informative of what was going to happen .

title: Excellent practice
body: I needed consultation this last month saw doctor who was very good and things were tested and there was good follow up

title: Excellent practice
body: I needed consultation this last month saw doctor who was very good and things were tested and there was good follow up

title: Fantastic service
body: I had surgery on my big toe on01/02/23 I felt no pain and apart from some bleeding and slightly uncomfortable no after effects at all a week later the district nurse is amazed how well its healing it was severely overgranulated on both sides and bled constantly for a year prior to surgery I cannot speak highly enough of the staff

author: melw23
title: I’m ultra-cured, ultrafine (a poem)
body:
“I’ve got a rash.”  
“Allergy: try tablets”  
“I’m covered in spots.”  
“Eczema: try steroid cream”  
“My skin is itchy.”  
“Psoriasis: try coal tar”  
“My skin is scaly.”  
“Lichen planus: go to hospital.”  
I feel like a leper unclean.  
I really don’t want to be seen.  
Scared for my body. Full of doubt.  
I’ve no confidence to go out.  
Wow! The diagnosis is right.  
The doctors have now seen the light.  
Photo biology  
will solve my malady.  
And I will not be such a sight.  
Thirty sessions with a head shield  
And my poor old body was healed.  
Ultra violet made me shine  
I’m ultra-cured, ultrafine.  
I’m no longer red and spotted.  
My husband is right besotted.  
It took a year I must confess.  
But now I thank the NHS.

author: Carol23
title: The gratitude I feel about the service I got
body:
At the beginning of April I asked my daughter to phone an ambulance after a period of severe pain and violent sickness. Never in a million years would I ever think of phoning an ambulance, but I was desperate. Arriving at Antrim area hospital, I was sent straight to EMSU C3. From the moment I stepped into the clinic room I felt safe, my biggest fear was I couldn't explain how I felt, I am rarely ill I am very much in tune with my body so I was so stressed and afraid of not being believed. I was taken for ultrasound scan and then MRI and met the consultant\surgeon who was going to perform this surgery, and yes it was all that fast.  
Mr Eltayeb will be forever in my heart as one of the nicest people I ever met. This man is the leader of a team and I think this team are blessed to have him as a mentor, you cannot lead others effectively if you cannot communicate. It's inevitable we can hear through the thin veil of curtain, this man spoke to everyone in the same calming tone, explaining difficult procedures in the simplest way so we all could understand. I have never felt more content heading for surgery.  
I want to mention other members of team EMSU at level 3. Rachael, Karthik, Baby, Siobhan, Sarah, the girl on ultra sound, the nurse and radiologist at MRI (they didn't have an easy patient) the anaesthetist, the nurse in theatre, and all the doctors Dr Lui. The after care was amazing, again Mr Eltayeb explained the procedure he had done and told it like he had baked the perfect victoria sponge :) This mans ability to communicate with empathy and understanding builds trust and respect with his patients, Antrim Area Hospital should feel proud to have him.  
I never actually got to a proper ward, I was still on a trolley bed in the assessment unit from day one, the nurses continually apologised for this, it never bothered me in the slightest because of the excellent care I received. The wet slice of ham, lettuce and pineapple salad never tasted so good, it was my first bite in two days, but the icing on the cake for me was two ginger snap biscuits with a cup of tea, it tasted like afternoon tea at the Ritz. Not forgetting the lovely staff that served it.  
For all you male and females who choose nursing as a vocation you really have to be extra special people to go out of your way in order to make others feel better is exceptional. I will be forever grateful for my good experience in EMSU at Antrim Area Hospital, hopefully it will be my last trip for a very long while, so to all of you, while thank you seems inadequate, it's all I have :)  
[Very happy with 'Treatment']

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: charliefj64
title: The care and support I have received so far has been outstanding
body: In mid January 2023 I was diagnosed with diabetes and my GP referred me to the Diabetes Centre in the Ulster Hospital. I got a call offering me an appointment for later that day. When I got to the Diabetes Centre I saw a Dr, then specialist nurse then a Dietician. As well as explaining everything to me they gave me all my medication and a glucometer. Following that first appointment I had a call with the nurse every few days to check how I was doing which meant I had that care and reassurance but I could also continue to work. The care and support I have received so far has been outstanding and I cannot praise everyone enough.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: DoubleTrouble
title: Can’t praise the staff enough. Thank you.
body: All the staff and doctors in the Endoscopy unit were excellent. They were so kind and caring and they explained everything- putting you at ease right away. The unit was extremely well organised and went like clockwork. I was in at 8am and back home by 11am. Can’t praise the staff enough. Thank you.

links.id: nervous but staff put you at ease

author: empathymx73
title: The Treatment I Received
body: I went in for a total knee replacement and the treatment I received was absolutely fantastic.Everyone I came into contact with was friendly, helpful and totally committed to making my stay as comfortable as possible.It was certainly 5 star service.I am very grateful to all the staff.

title: Practice nurse
body: Today I had an ECG and a BP monitor fitted. Nurse was efficient, friendly, speedy, thorough and relaxing. We patients are lucky to have this kind of service.

title: Awful service
body: The receptionist are rude no mannors think there doctors when all they are there for is too make appointments which they even struggle with that speak to people with no respect at all need sacking

title: Great practice
body: Service was fanatic everybody is so pleasant no problems what so ever many thanks to everyone for your help and care

title: Good experience
body: Always willing to discuss health when I have concerns over surgery and arranges quick clinical services such as scans, xrays bloodtests when needed

title: No Appointments
body: unable to book an appointment as the receptionist doesn't care to answers the phone, when they do (normally after an hour of trying) answer the phone  they just say all appointments are taken. This has been going on for years with this clinic. Ive even been at the clinic and watched them just ignore the phone till it rings off without batting an eyelid of concern. Get the reception some assistance to focus on the phones early in the morning and not leave them alone unmanaged.

title: Really looked after.
body: Recently seen one the doctors and a follow-up appointment with the nurse the overall service was brilliant!

title: Superb Care by Ambulance Service, A&E and West…
body: I called an Ambulance for the elderly father recently, the Ambulance Service provided superb care and excellent communication every step. They even returned to visit my father in A&E after their shift had finished to wish him well, it really perked my Dad up, they didn't have to do that, they chose to, that was really kind.  A&E Staff were magnificent, after I stayed with my Dad over night, seeing them work so hard.  West Dereham Ward staff are incredibly kind, level of care has been so high. They really do look after the families too.

author: lepusjh43
title: I will not be comfortable seeking care for the same problem in future.
body:
I was admitted due to severe abdominal pain. A consultant came into the room to do a transvaginal ultrasound and a FY1 followed in with the consultant however, they never even introduced themselves to me (I only now know their name from my discharge letter) and during the scan, while my legs were in stirrups and I was extremely exposed, they wandered around the room. This left me with very little dignity. After the scan, I had asked the FY1 questions about what was found and they informed me that they were not sure as they were not a gynaecologist. I had been asked by a consultant to do a self swab so I closed the door and the blue curtain to do this and as I was pulling my dress down, the FY1 entered my room without knocking or asking to come in.  
I had been told the previous night that I needed to fast for the ultrasound as they wanted to look at organs other than my reproductive organs, to rule out other causes, however this did not happen. The general surgeons were asked to review me based off the scans of my reproductive organs and unsurprisingly the general surgeons did not see a need to intervene as these scans were mostly normal. After reviewing my scans, the general surgeon still had to clarify with me whether or not I had both ovaries and fallopian tubes which is concerning. I had waited from 10am until 4:30pm for the general surgeons to review these scans which they knew were mostly normal and also not the area which general surgery is concerned about as a scan of my liver and kidneys were not done as stated the previous night. I could have returned home after this scan instead of being made hopeful that something may be done or found.  
I was informed that my only option now was to stay for pain management but no other investigations were going to be carried out as they are unsure what is causing the pain. I became very upset by this as I obviously wanted to know why I was in so much pain and after suffering for years before being diagnosed with endometriosis, being told we do not know is very deflating especially when the only investigations carried out was a set of bloods and a transvaginal ultrasound. I found the FY1 did not show any sympathy and just stared awkwardly.  
After reviewing my discharge letter, I found a number of problems with it and asked to speak with a doctor to clarify some points. The FY1 was sent to discuss these with me. For the first few minutes, they did not bother to close the door despite me being very upset and crying and other patients having visitors at that time. However, all the issues I had found were brushed off as not being important so I chose to leave without them being corrected.  
I was diagnosed with endometriosis in 2019 but as this pain is significantly different to what I am used to, I would have thought at least an abdominal ultrasound would have been carried out, as stated, to rule out nearby organs causing the pain. But instead, I was sent home with the same we don’t know I had to deal with for the 3 years prior to my endometriosis diagnosis.  
I found the FY1 was extremely dismissive, ill-informed and lacked bedside manners. Despite giving both themselves and the consultant a copy of my current and past medications, they were unsure what I was on and what I have tried previously. I had asked her twice to speak with the consultant about an anti-spasmodic but never got back to me about this so I am unsure if they ever did. Entering rooms with the curtain closed, wandering the room during a transvaginal ultrasound and not closing the door during a conversation when a patient is very upset showed me a total lack of self awareness and bedside manner. And due to this, my discharge letter is riddled with inaccuracies which have not been corrected and I will not be comfortable seeking care for the same problem in future.  
In addition, due to being discharged at 7pm on a Saturday, I was sent home without an adequate supply of pain relief to last me until Monday. I made the FY1 aware of this and they stated it would be difficult to get anymore due to the time. I was not written up for any medication while on the ward, I was self-administering my own supply from home. But as I was discharged based off an ultrasound done early morning, this should have been arranged when obtaining medication was possible.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Very efficient and kind
body: on 9th February I attended ESH A & E following a Gp appointment.  The service I received was very thorough and also very kind.  The Clinical staff treated me with respect and also communicated very well, letting me know when things were taking longer to arrange and also letting me know they had handed my care over to another doctor when they went of shift. I was in A and E 7 hours, it was very busy.  But kindness and good communication made this more bearable.  Thank you

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Very friendly and helpful staff. The online portal is also a good addition. Had a regular check up there today which was quick and efficient.

title: Fantastic staff
body: Yes the phone lines are a pain but maybe if we funded the NHS properly they could install a better system. Reception staff polite, professional & understanding. Medical staff take the time to ask the leading questions and listen to the answers, definitely saving lives. Thank you

title: ENT Need lessons on how to answer a phoneq
body:
I have tried contacting ENT for 3 days via the phone to change an appointment. This has resulted in called up to 100 times a day with no answer. 
Bookings team were unable to assist as its an ENT appointment. 
Completely unacceptable and hospitals wonder why patients 'miss' appointments

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Kindness and consideration
body: Wife of a patient can't thank the team enough for their kindness and consideration.

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: Good practice
body: I was pleased with the friendly professional way the nurses did my procedure. They made me feel comfortable and explained everything clearly.

title: Brilliant practice
body: I have been very impressed with the attention that I've received. The staff are very friendly, efficient and professional.

author: Alexe98
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Concerned about blood tests
body:
I was concerned about the blood tests that have been taken, as I did not understand why they were being done.  
Otherwise, the team have been wonderful

readBy.name: Southern Health Mid & North Hampshire Division

title: Excellent care
body: The Receptionist was so kind and helpful and  spoke to me very calmly and  made it less stressful to get me seen as quickly as possible and send me to the right department.  An excellent service from everyone.

title: Excellent service
body: All staff involved were helpful and reassuring.  However, I did think that the lighting was rather glary, given that all the patients were there to have treatment for their eyes.

author: LJ97
title: The fact that I was only treated by women meant such a lot
body:
I was fast tracked to the cancer pathway after some post-menopausal bleeding. I had an ultrasound followed by an appointment on Ward 1B at Pilgrim hospital & further tests.  
Everyone was so kind, caring & compassionate. The procedure I had was explained every step of the way. Sr. Palmer, the nurse practitioner, Tracy & Janet were fantastic & really made me feel at ease.  
The fact that I was only treated by women meant such a lot. I was reassured that all was well & I could be taken off the pathway list.  
I felt so relieved & reassured & it was all because of the exemplary treatment I received.

author: AN78
title: She listened to me and went above and beyond
body:
I attended a gynae referral appointment and I would really appreciate it if you could please send my thanks to Dr Meehan whom took my consultation and Dr Ayyoub for inviting me along to his clinic.  
I was so nervous and uptight attending, but Dr Meehan from the minute she introduced herself, was so kind, caring and went out of her way to help. She listened to me and went above and beyond and really put my mind at rest.  
I can honestly not thank her enough and she is definitely fantastic at her job as well as the caring and personal side to the appointment, which was so important in my case. She is a credit to obstetrics and gynaecology and the South Eastern trust.  
Thank you from the bottom of my heart.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mackylou
title: So gentle and good-natured.
body: Throughout my stay in Antrim Area Hospital, I was treated extremely well by EMSU staff in ward C3. I previously had to undergo surgery due to appendicitis. The staff were so kind and supportive before and after my procedure. A staff member named Merin had taken great care of me post-surgery that night as she was so gentle and good-natured.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: cassiopeiaft57
title: Getting on the Eastleigh rehab pathway
body:
I enjoyed the pre rehab groups and the guys running the group were brilliant.  
I could not believe how straightforward it was to get funding for rehab. I am off to rehab right now and I am so grateful, thanks so much.

author: Bluebird2
title: I was in good hands for colonoscopy
body:
Had a colonoscopy at DRI. Was very worried about it but was reassured from start to finish I was in good hands.  
I would just like to praise their professionalism also the recovery experience after the procedure.  
All in all a good result for me.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Seen promptly
body: I broke my nose after falling and was referred to ent from a&e. I was seen very promptly and dealt with respectfully and with great care. Thank you.

author: Wood23
title: Having my leg put into plaster
body: After a nasty leg break, an op and a spell on the ward. The girls in the plaster room at FVRH put me in plaster. Those girls were Julie, Nicole and Claire. Not only did they greet me with a cheerful smile and kind words, they carried out the task skilfully and I am happy to say that I was in very little discomfort. What an absolutely fab team. Thank you to you all.

title: Not impressed....sad to say.
body:
Further follow up ct/mri appt has to be yet arranged- advised 8/9 weeks wait, but is now 16 weeks from last appt
I have left three messages on the secretary's answerphone, over the last 2/3 weeks- asking for a status of where I am in the system and could I have a call back.  The silence is deafening!!

Scanner depts at Maidstone and Pembury, and General Appointments depts have confirmed I have no further appointments arranged. 

Am I to leave answerphone messages each day -until I receive an answer?

author: cbnhsfife
title: My mothers experience with Diabetes.
body:
This has happened at our GP practice in Fife. I know the name of the nurse but don't feel right naming and shaming publicly.  
This is not a positive experience I am afraid. I am writing on behalf of my mother who within the last 6 months has been diagnosed with type 2 diabetes and has been trying to adjust. I know that there are many pleasant, kind and caring health care workers as I work closely with several different departments.  
My mother has been dealing with a particular nurse at the medical practice. The way in which my nearly 60 year old mother has been made to feel is like a child and not an adult. I would also like to say that she is very anxious about me writing this because this is a person (the nurse) the public should look up to, respect and not expect to be belittled by. As a result my mother is afraid to speak out.  
From what I have been told, very little support has been given to my mother during the last 6 months following on from her diagnosis. It is like she has just been told to get on with it. It has been very hard for her to come to terms with this new diagnosis as she doesn't understand why it has happened to her (amongst other things, heart disease, fibromyalgia).  
My mother has advised me of the following incidents or things that have been said to my mother by the nurse:  
My mother has had 2 stents fitted and is on 3 different medications a day for this particular reason. My mum attended an appointment expecting a heart review and to discuss her diabetes. My mother was informed I will not be doing your heart review today as the diabetes is more important.  
My mother has had palpitations for as long as I can remember. She had advised the nurse that she was getting palpitations in her neck, to which the nurse stated that will be lack of hormones that is causing the palpitations in your neck, which is fine, however I think a little bit more clarification is needed here. Please explain further what is meant by this - reassure her that you are aware of her heart condition, and it is normal to think the palpitations are a result of this but that it is actually something else. My mother is also on medication for menopause. The nurse also told my mother that she does not have Fibromyalgia, it will be lack of hormones for whatever it is she is feeling right now.  
We have a family friend who informed my mother that they give out glucose monitors to diabetic patients - when my mother enquired the nurse about this, she stated I don't give out monitors as they aren't helpful as blood sugars go up and down throughout the day.  
My mother had a follow up telephone appointment with the nurse to discuss levels etc. My mothers Hb1a readings had come down by 6 between the first and second reading. Instead of supporting my mother, the nurse abruptly asked what carbs are you eating?. It was only after my mother told the nurse that she had also lost 12lb between the first reading and second reading that the nurses tone changed.  
An English NHS diabetic food list was printed and given to my mother - this is absolutely fine, but again it was handed to her and that was that. No discussion. She was also told to download the Freshwell app. I work in clinical trials, and things need to be explained thoroughly to participants so that they completely understand the why's, what's and how's. I feel like this particular nurse is missing the mark when it comes to ensuring patients are comfortable, listened to and properly cared for.  
My mother is not finding this nurse to be reassuring or considerate at all which is extremely disappointing. Yes diabetes is manageable and you can live with it, but my mothers life changed over night and she had no idea where to start. She is still confused and is having to look up things by herself or ask other friends/family members who are also diabetic how they manage. This should not be happening.  
I am not asking you to hand hold but please show people who are being diagnosed with any disease, regardless of severity, that you care about their wellbeing and that you want to help. Nobody want's their parents or family members being treated this way so I have had enough.  
Again, I want to make it very clear that I have worked, and still work with many great, amazing and fantastic doctors and nurses. It just breaks my heart every time my mother comes back from an appointment feeling deflated. I hope this can be resolved, I am sorry it has had to come to this. Happy to discuss further.

author: Anngr73
title: Professionalism and compassion from radiology staff
body:
I recently had to attend for an MRI scan of my ankle at Stracathro hospital. The reception staff were very friendly and the the unit absolutely spotless.  
The Health Care Support Worker and the 2 radiographers carrying out my scan couldn't have been nicer. Their professionalism, care and compassion was very much appreciated and they are a credit to the radiology department and to NHS Tayside.  
I'm so grateful to have been able to have this investigation locally and by such wonderful staff.

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Tramua ward has been good
body:
Trauma ward has honestly been pretty grand so far. I really don't think I've a reason to complain about anything.  
The staff have honestly been the reason I haven't had an issue they have been absolute wonderful like anything that I need from them. They are willing to help me out with anything. If I need anything explained they are there just excellent.  
I have enjoyed the food the way its cooked is great. I honestly am quite happy with the food I get. I haven't an issue at all I'm very happy with it.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: email appointment's
body: I cannot fault the service that you get with this practice. all the staff are so understanding and always willing to listen and help. I am loving this new way to make an appointment; and order medication, I struggle with time due to work and having a disabled son. The ladies always give me the best advice when I ring. The Doctors are very caring and very professional also explain in detail. I am very happy with the practice.

author: Violet71
title: Treated with care & compassion
body: I entered Dame Carol Detoxification Centre for an 8 day detox prior to moving to Kenward House for rehabilitation. I am an alcoholic who was drinking up to 3 bottles of wine a day. On the day I arrived I had had a drink as I was told that this was ok as long as I did not arrived very inebriated. During my 8 day stay I have been treated with care and compassion by every member of staff. Medication has been prescribed daily as well as Vitamin B complex injections for 5 days and then tablets. My BP has slowly reduced as a result of this and the monitor 4 times a day which displays the attention to detail of the care that I have been given. I have been listened to and everything that has been prescribed has been explained to me. I feel as though I have been treated without judgement which has been a huge help as I was quite apprehensive before I arrived. In addition we have had meditation sessions and daily groups to talk through addition issues and problems. I have no complaints and would highly recommend this facility.

author: cafefd54
title: Our son's OT was fantastic
body:
We had the pleasure of using Forth Valley Paediatric OT Department for our child.  
We were looking for some help and support to allow him to progress in school with some difficulties he was having. Jenny our OT was absolutely fantastic. She was kind, professional and very understanding during the numerous assessments she conducted.  
The report she produced to help our son move forward is exceptionally detailed and demonstrates the knowledge and expertise she has. No expense was spared with the time Jenny devoted to helping our child and we are very grateful for all her work.

author: Holden23
title: I thank your staff for an impressive experience in such harrowing and distressful times.
body:
I am writing to you as Head of a Health and Social Care Trust, to say how impressed I was with the treatment I received at the Radiotherapy Unit, Luke Building at Northampton Hospital.  
I attended the unit for a course of radiotherapy. The staff were welcoming, friendly and above all professional in their treatment of me and other patients who attended the unit. I spent five and half weeks having treatment on a daily basis and although there were delays occasionally due to pressures on the technicians and nurses they always were friendly, affable and carried out their work in an efficient and organised way.  
Before retirement I was an academic in a Business School and travelled all over the world visiting many business organisations in a variety of contexts. Some of them were hospitals but most were in the private sector. One can tell whether an organisation is doing well by the reception one initially receives and the general air of friendliness from dedicated staff. This is not always the case in many private companies. I was struck by the dedication and professionalism of your staff and would like them to receive some kind of thanks from the senior levels of your organisation.  
One of the staff, Christian, told me he was studying for a diploma in radiotherapy and he related to me his final thesis and how he wished to carry on his studies to Masters degree level. He said he was reliant on getting a grant from the trust. If he does receive such a grant I know he will continue to be a great asset to the unit and the Hospital as is the leader of the team Sarah.  
From my perspective Northampton Genera Hospital is a well run organisation in which I received friendliness and help from staff at reception to support staff who offered me a ride down the long Hospital Street.  
I thank your staff for an impressive experience in such harrowing and distressful times.  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']

author: hadargt78
title: The value of the multi-faceted care provision
body:
For last 8 weeks l have had the support of Zoe, Physio Support Worker, Domiciliary Physio Service, Brooksby, Largs, North Ayrshire. Today Zoe bade me goodbye after providing outstanding care and advice over these long winter weeks. As l reflect on this, my first experience of a regular visit from an nhs specialist, l surely realise the value of the multi-faceted care provision, free at the point of delivery, making such a singularly vital component of our lives here in UK!  
In particular, Zoe was a most pleasant visitor to my home but came as a highly motivated, knowledgeable and competent health professional. She was here to perform a task requiring skill, patience and an understanding of how to pass on detailed instructions to best ensure positive outcomes for her patients. Her breadth of knowledge was clearly evident; she assessed risk as a priority and did so with care and attention to detail that inspired confidence in her judgements; she was observant of details that the patient (ie me,) would never have considered as matters of risk; she was thorough to the extent of accessing other relevant services on my behalf; she engaged easily making her visits pleasantly comfortable; she kept me fully informed at all times. From my perspective Zoe has been a much welcomed and positive ‘intervention’ in my life. Her work on my behalf has been highly respected and appreciated by both my wife and myself!

title: Fantastic Service from People Under Pressure
body:
First off, parking is a nightmare as always but due to the location there is little that can be done about this. 
Visited A&E and through every step the staff were brilliant - from the team on door/reception helping to book you in and direct you, the triage nurses, the doctors and the radiology staff. Everyone of them is working under unimaginable pressures and yet each was kind, caring and knowledgeable. My total stay was around 7 hours involving a multitude of tests, after which I was discharged with clear instructions on what my next steps should be. Sincere thanks to all the staff who need our support more than ever. The A&E department is a credit to the hospital.

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: Shinergiser
title: The first class service continues...
body:
Return visit to the Fracture Clinic and looked after by Magda and Kevin this time round - stitches removed without pain, dressings changed, Moon boot fitted, advice giving and on my way on the next stage of recovery.  
Thanks again to everyone in the team, the reception staff, nursing staff and even the guys in the restaurant!

author: alphayz65
title: A&E Visit after toddler head injury.
body: I attended UHW A&E department after my 4 year old daughter fell and cut her head open at home. We arrived around 6pm and were treated and discharged by 7.15pm. Everyone we encountered were extremely helpful, friendly and polite. A real credit to our NHS in such difficult times. Thank you.

author: Mmca2
title: Thanks to the out of hours service
body: Many thanks to the South Eastern Trust GP Out of Hours Service. I received a call back very promptly and the GP Dr Crawford was very understanding and helpful, taking me seriously, and getting me the right treatment immediately. The lady who triaged my call was professional and caring. I am very appreciative of the excellent standard of care I have received.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: No medical care now for housebound patents
body: My dad came out of Hospital and is now housebound he is very ill but the family has asked for a doctor to come and see him 4 times but she will not come out and the receptionist says yer yer yer when we say he needs to see a doctor all they have sent to our house is a paramedic who did nothing for my dad so my dad is still ill and he can not even get basic medical treatment from this doctors surgery.

title: Amazing Nightingale Ward
body:
My son was admitted this week to Nightingale ward.  I cannot thank or commend the staff enough for their help.  The volunteers. Play staff. Cleaners. Health care assistants. Nurses. Doctors and consultants. Every single person gave my son their 100% attention, care and compassion.  Cleaners stopped in the corridor to play with him.  Volunteers stopped to try and make him laugh.  Consultants made examinations fun and light hearted. Even the worst procedures were done with such care and attempts to make them not scary. The play assistants regularly checked to see if he wanted toys swapping to keep him occupied and they have a wonderful selection.  So much so he didn't want to leave!  One of the play assistants showed him her beautiful disney paintings in the conservatory. 

The Consultants are knowledgeable, informative and very thorough. We saylw many different people and I cannot fault any of them.  The nurses and health care assistants give you all of their time. Constantly checking if my son needed anything. You can see how busy they are but that never comes across and we had such good care.  Thank you all to the amazing team on Nightingale ward.  

I would also like to shout out to the imaging department for making an xray exciting for my son and not scary. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Chesterfield Royal Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I attended for what turned out to just be a bad viral infection but I didn’t know this at the time so I was quite frightened at not being able to breathe. Despite being so incredibly busy, every single staff member was kind, patient and knowledgeable. I also witnessed them being exactly the same to other patients, including those who were frustrated with the wait time.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: friendly and relaxing
body: I was so well treated  by so many friendly staff I was made to feel like a v i p and throughout the day there was always someone there to reassure me. As an nervous older patient I could not have asked for better treatment from everyone. I cannot speak highly enough of my experience. Well done everyone

title: Worst GP Ever
body: First it takes forever for the receptionist to answer the phone, secondly the good doctors at this practice have unfortunately now left. I had an appointment today and my new doctor was completely incompetent and suggested methods that's were entirely not within my budget. She refused to help me with the organisation of a blood test and spoke in a patronising manner. She then followed up with methods that required me to fork out money via a private route.

author: Cland93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: an uplifting experience
body: Having been in Male Surgical for the past week I am ready to leave.  I came in very sick, but with the help of the doctors and nurses I am well on the road to recovery.  I live on my own so my stay in hospital has been such an uplifting experience for me, I get my meals handed to me and all the cups of tea I could ask for.  All the nurses go above and beyond their duties to make me feel relaxed and well cared for.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Cland93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Excellent
body:
I arrived into Male Medical on Thursday afternoon after being moved from A&E, I honestly didn't think I was bad enough to be admitted, but I am not medically trained so I didn't argue.  
I genuinely could not say anything negative about my time here. Every question I asked was answered and was kept well informed on why I was in and how long I would need to stay. Doctors, Nurses and the Care Staff are all invaluable and I would not have made such a speedy recovery without them.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Receptions are our front line workers
body:
Yesterday I visited the surgery as I needed information and clarity around appointments.  I was full of fear around a medical issue and in that became somewhat chaotic and confused in asking questions and retaining information.  Through all of it the young receptionist remained kind and helpful.  
Later that day when I processed my visit to the surgery and the calmness I received in my chaos, I realized that our receptions are front line workers.  They are the first people the patients see.  They are the first ones who are subjected to the fears, frustrations, and angers of those of us who are worried about our health or the health of our children.  They are the ones we sometimes expect an answer from with regards to our medical conditions…questions they are unable to answer.  On top of this they need to be answering the many phone calls to the surgery, constantly be accessing the computer to make/change appointments, and often trying to juggle appointments when someone needs to cancel or change ones already made.  And this goes on all day, every day.  Few of us are under that kind of pressure on a daily basis.  
I hope in those times of me feeling fearful and frustrated I can remember to be understanding and kind to our front line workers.  They want to help us.

author: tigerkt68
title: Long Covid Clinic
body:
I took Covid Aug 2021 it hit me pretty hard, I was in ICU for 9 weeks. When I was discharged home I was seen by the respiratory nurses because I was on oxygen. Before I took covid I had COPD but it was well managed. I used to go to the gym and do spin. The respiratory nurses and physio came out to me at home. I had physio and got my oxygen levels checked when I was walking. The respiratory nurses thought that the Long Covid Clinic would be good for me. I went to the rehab classes in Mid Ulster hospital they helped me to get my strength back. The clinics were brilliant, they gave me confidence again and gave me the opportunity to speak to other people. In ICU I had dreams and hallucinations, when I was coming out of the coma, I thought I was going doolally. The classes gave me the chance to speak to other people who had experienced the same sort of thing as me, I was reassured this had happened to other people as well, I wasn’t on my own.  
One day Elaine came to talk to us, that was very good, she explained a lot of things, about the dreams, about the energy that had been taken from me. When I was at the classes I cried a lot, Elaine approached me and offered me the opportunity to speak to her. I had a couple of sessions with Elaine, she helped me to understand this is the way it is. She referred me to a psychologist, Hanna, she just let me talk through things. The way she approached me helped me to talk it out. I can’t remember much about being unwell and coming into hospital. But I do remember before I went into coma, I asked the doctor what my chances were for survival, he said, ‘Not great’. He advised me to say anything I wanted to, to my children that affected me very badly. At the time I was so exhausted I just wanted to go to sleep but when I got home it hit me what could have been.  
The rehab only lasted 6 weeks but they put me through the 6 weeks a 2nd time. It was great, I miss it, it gave me a purpose in life, something to get up and do, to get going.  
I still think about the dreams, I still feel on edge and confused if I wake up from sleeping. I really think I still need support, although when I finished the sessions with Elaine and Hanna I thought I was OK.  
My experience of the rehab clinic was excellent, they couldn’t have done any more for me.  
My GP didn’t even know I was in hospital, till I came out, he has rang me once since I was discharged, I have had very little contact with him.  
Rehab twice a week gave me motivation, now days any outing for me is to a hospital appointment. Covid has changed my life a lot.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Jadss85
title: Excellent support from A&E staff
body:
I'd just like to provide some feedback regarding a member of staff at Doncaster hospital who was working in A&E.  
She was a lovely lady with dark hair, I think she had glasses too, she was on the left desk as you walk through the main doors into A&E at 12pm when I checked my daughter in. I was in floods of tears over an argument I'd had with my daughters Dad just before getting to A&E, she tried her best to calm me down and was really understanding and patient with my crying aswell as trying to make me feel better and making sure my daughter was seen as quickly as possible.  
It's little things like that in a time of crisis that I'll never forget, please could someone pass on my thanks and appreciation 🩷

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: pepperzp89
title: Surgical unit Stracathro Hospital
body:
Attended the surgical unit today for a day surgery procedure. First class service was received from the moment I entered the building. Ward Staff friendly and welcoming, procedure clearly explained and given the opportunity to ask questions. Theatre staff equally welcoming, put me at ease and made sure I was aware of everything that was about to happen. Ward spotlessly clean, and prior to discharge self care and medication to be administered explained fully.  
A very important unit for Angus, I felt more at ease receiving services within my local community rather than having to travel to Dundee and attend a bigger hospital.

author: Leah63
title: Fantastic care on Ward 210 ERI
body: I went in for major abdominal surgery and was a little nervous as I'd only ever been a day patient. However, the way I was treated definitely exceeded expectations and I received the most amazingly supportive and compassionate care from every single member of staff I met at the ERI - nurses, theatre staff, cleaners, catering, Napier nursing students, doctors. Particular thanks to the Ward 210 Manager for leading a great team. I've already written to NHS Lothian privately to express my thanks, but wanted to put something on a public site.

author: Ketogirl
title: Is there an alternative to carb-heavy hospital food?
body:
I was admitted to SAL for surgery - lipomodelling following reconstruction after breast cancer. As it was only planned for day surgery I knew I wouldn't be eating much but in preparation took some cheese/nuts as I follow a keto/low carb way of eating.  
Unfortunately I ended up staying on the ward until late that evening and overnight on Branston - no issue with that as a minor complication occurred.  
The part I find most frustrating is the complete inability to provide food that is not carb heavy - the hospital menu is proof of this. I was offered toast/sandwich or yoghurt on SAL neither of which I eat but felt that toast was the only option. Again the next morning toast and cereal are the only available option for breakfast.  
I'm not sure if you provide a different menu for diabetics but there is overwhelming evidence that a low(er) carb lifestyle is one of the best ways to control blood sugars and ultimately the potential for remission of type 2 diabetes.  
I'm am not a diabetic but on asking if there were alternatives I was not offered anything else. I appreciate individual needs cannot always be met but would be very interested to know if there are plans to address these issues.

author: davidsmumuk
title: Mixed sex ward and lack of privacy
body:
I have been a patient twice before in the Ninewells AMU ward and they were both thoroughly unpleasant experiences, made much worse by the mixed sex aspect of the ward and a series of errors on the part of both nursing and medical staff.  
On the third occasion, in January 2023, I reluctantly allowed myself to be taken to the AMU again by ambulance. Not much has changed, except the toilet/showers do now have signs specifying Gents or Ladies. Previously men were regularly using what staff had told me were the ladies’ toilets. One thing that was worse was the constantly ringing unanswered telephone that was on the edge of the bay, adding to the general stress of the ward.  
I find it extraordinary that the government and Tayside Health Board think it is acceptable to have mixed sex wards and bays in some cases, including AMU, Ninewells. For the Health Board to stress the importance of privacy and dignity is deeply cynical, while using mixed bays as standard procedure and, particularly, when the beds are in such close proximity to each other that it is impossible to avoid hearing all the private details of other patients' symptoms and circumstances when discussed with doctors or nurses who don't seem to feel it necessary to even lower their voices.  
On this occasion, the patient in the next bed wasn't even given the decency of a curtain pulled round the bed although clearly embarrassed when called upon to discuss his symptoms with staff and even more so when he started to vomit.  
The elderly man across the way from me was fortunate enough to have the curtain drawn around him before the doctor loudly explained to him that he was going to give him a physical rectal examination and proceeded to explain in great detail how exactly that was going to be done. Unbelievably, this examination was then carried out right there with all the other patients cringing at the shouts of pain from the poor man. This seems to be very much lacking in terms of respecting privacy or dignity and I personally, found the situation deeply upsetting.  
On a separate issue, I pointed out to the nurse that I had brought my own prescribed medicines but I hadn’t been given any of them all day. She said that I would have to do without them because the doctor hadn’t written them up. I asked for them back but was refused.  
When I was discharged, on Friday evening, my medicines still hadn't been returned to me. I would have had to go all weekend without any of them if it hadn't been for my wonderful pharmacist helping me out with emergency prescriptions.  
I did get my medicines delivered to me by Ninewells on the following Monday, with a note attached, saying “left in ward”. Strange, I thought it would be the staff’s responsibility to give them back to me on discharge.  
The combined effect of my having suffered being a patient at AMU, Ninewells on three occasions is that I will not go back there, no matter what the circumstances.

author: simpsla
title: Great care and compassion shown to my Father
body:
My Dad recently took ill requiring him to be admitted to Monklands Hospital. Due to the symptoms he was experiencing we needed to call an ambulance.  
I would like to take this opportunity to personally thank the crew who attended my Dad at such a worrying and stressful time. Michael and Andrew, thank you from myself, my Dad and my Mum on the care, compassion and professionalism you showed my Dad. You went out you way to ensure he was kept updated and taken care of.  
Both of you are a credit to the Scottish Ambulance Service and NHS.  
Thank you.

author: AARK
title: X-ray
body: I had to have an x-ray. Very quick and efficient all round

author: JeanSm2
title: Treated well for my ankle injury
body:
My son took me to Arbroath Infirmary to get my injury to my foot checked out.  
Went to minor injuries unit and the staff could not have been nicer, examined by a nurse and was told to come back next morning for an x-ray. X-ray revealed 2 broken bones, was given a moon boot to use and crutches and got a referral to orthopaedic virtual follow up.  
Can’t thank staff enough for their help and found everyone extremely kind.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: roy007
title: Long Covid Clinic/ Post Covid Syndrome
body:
To be perfectly honest I have no memory of ICU, I was there for 3 weeks. I believed I was in the worst hotel in Portugal, I just wanted to get home. I rang my wife asking her to get me home, my mind was totally gone. My grandson told me the flight was booked to get me home that settled me down but I fought tooth and nail to get out of hospital.  
We live in a bungalow, previously my wife had been unwell we had grab handles in place for her, before I took covid I wasn’t using them, but they were there for me when I got home. I had lost 3 stone in weight, I could hardly walk, if I turned my head at all I was dizzy. I had two legs that didn’t look like my own they had lost muscle mass they were wee fine legs. I was using a rolator and still on oxygen. I was able to get out of bed and walk to the toilet that was enough, I had to build up my strength slowly.  
The hospital referred me to the Community Respiratory Nurses, Peter saw me the very next day at home. . I was delighted to get home I hadn’t seen my family in 3 weeks, my wife had covid locked in the house, I had it, locked in the hospital.  
Peter provided advise, exercises and encouragement to keep going and not to over do it, although I know I did it. I tried to do too much when I was walking and became dizzy, this was months after I got out of hospital, I was staggering about all over the place. I didn’t want anyone to see me incase they thought I was drunk, that was about 11’oclock in the morning.  
Peter also arranged for me to attend, a twice weekly, 6 week duration rehab programme. It was excellent, Peter and Marie ran it, the simple fact that you were talking to people who had gone through the same as me, I realised I wasn’t doting and everything I had experienced was real.  
Peter also arranged for Elaine to contact me, if it hadn’t have been for Peter and Elaine, I feel I would have taken my own life. They helped me so much. I had terrible feelings of guilt because I was depending on everyone else to do things for me, I had to pay people to cut my grass and hedges, my wife had to bring my tea into me. Elaine helped me to accept that for the past 63 years I have helped everyone else now it’s time for them to help me. I felt there were are brighter days ahead.  
The best thing about it all is meeting people who have been through the same thing and being able to talk about it, I now join Elaine’s zoom meetings. Lately I have had difficulty with my eyes and through this meeting I have discovered other people with the same or similar problems.  
In December I was back in hospital with pneumonia, I felt anxious, I had rung the GP and got an appointment with the nurse practitioner. I got antibiotics but my breathing got worse, I rang the doctor, they told me I needed to go the hospital, I was back on oxygen. I feel like covid has made me 20 years older than I am. I was always a big strong man who could lift anything I wanted to without thinking about it, but now there are things I can’t do. I don’t feel depressed, but it was hard to accept how much covid has changed my life.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Rich23
title: Poor service.
body: Have been trying to contact the department today 14 times and no one picks up the phone. The calls are being redirected to the CPAP line and this then is not answered. The mask is a critical part of the apparatus and not being able to get a simple replacement even when you offer to go in at ones own inconvenience to collect a spare/replacement. Yes you can leave a message only if you call after 1400hrs, with a possibility they call back next day. Not sure what they think you do on the intervening nights sleep. Poor service.

author: Bravegirl
title: Pancreas injury
body:
My daughter sustained a trauma to her pancreas when a unit fell on her at a dance show. She was kept in intensive care for observation and then transferred to the ward for further recovery. 
The injuries she sustained were understandable considering the weight of the unit that fell on her but still shocking that it had caused such trauma to her internal organs. 
All the staff kept us informed and helped to keep us up to date, what to expect and worse case scenarios in case anything deteriorated quickly so we didn’t panic if she had to have surgery.
Things were explained well to my child in an age appropriate way and a pain chart with smiley faces was given so she could tell the staff and her parents how much pain she was in.

author: mad cat lady
title: ED care
body: I was seen in ED after midnight with an urgent symptom. The care I received from Jade, the HCA, was fabulous. She is a credit to the hospital.

author: Niki18
title: A pre-op assessment  at Antrim Area hospital.
body:
I had a good experience at my recent pre-op assessment.  
I was seen by three professionals, a pharmacist, a nurse and a specialist nurse.  
At each assessment I was treated respectively. I was fully informed and also given the opportunity to ask questions.  
While everyone was good Geraldine the specialist nurse was particularly helpful giving excellent clarity to each and every procedure, compassionate, patient and understanding regarding my needs. I am very grateful for a good experience. This relieved my anxiety of attending hospital regarding my pending surgery. Thank you.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
